title: Why is bronze so scared of off meta picks.

replies.body: yeah people needa wait until after the game to assess the result of the troll pick, but if they did feed then they're just bigger assholes than regular feeders
they see it on the live streams or on the tV and go, they won it must be good i HAVE to use that!
Because meta exists for a reason and players are bronze for a reason?

Meta exists because those are the most optimal champs without taking skill into account.

The second you take time spent on the champion and general game mechanics into account the meta becomes less important.

And as for bronze, 25% of the elo is smurfs, 25% are trolls, 5-10% dont belong there, and the other 40-45% are trash.

You could win a soccer game with 11 strikers. But a good team config includes a goalie some midfielders and a couple of fullbacks.

You could win a lol game with 5 adcs but a good team config includes cc, tankiness, and perhaps sustain. 

Once you get to late game i'd bet on a coordinated team with meta picks (cc, tank, mix of damage) and not the coordinated team of 5 adcs. Not to say the adcs would not win,  but i know who I'd bet on.

Off-meta is fine, but you should at least pick something that makes sense. Teemo support doesn't really make sense. He doesn't have much in the way of support. His 'poke' is too short range(will get counter-poked) and his ult comes too late to be of use. If I were to go against a teemo support in bot lane, I would play SO aggressive with deep wards.

As I said, off-meta is great. I love me some fiddlesticks jungle. Just make sure there's a logic behind what you play. Don't pick something like a zed support or varus top, because there's no reason for them to be in those lanes. They don't serve any purpose.

Id just like to point out that jungle is fiddlesticks meta position.

Just because he isnt top tier atm doesnt mean hes suddenly not meta.

Im talking more shit like hecarim support, taric top lane.

Ad soraka, draven top lane etc etc etc.

I don't think this fear is exclusive to bronze. Players of all ranks want to win and think that meta champs are the best way (and often are) to win. The only difference the higher you go is that people give you the benefit of the doubt just in case you're the second coming of Urgot.

Maybe because people aren't pro at the game and when you have had a teemo support take half your CS and ks every kill with his poison ... then you want people to just stick with champs who are good. Don't get me wrong I like off meta picks but if you want to win a ranked game in bronze/ silver playing something that isn't as good as a meta pick is just generally not a good idea unless you are super good at them.
